result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Forrest Matthew Thill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed With Prejudice 
*Reason:  The defendant has successfully completed all of the terms and conditions of the deferred entry of judgment

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*Fill all prescriptions from a single pharmacy
*Sign necessary releases so department can monitor compliance
*Comply with counseling as recommended by the agent 
*No contact with C.Z. with the exception of a letter of apology but only upon the DOC confirming that the victim wants any contact whatsoever.  If she does, then the letter of apology must be reviewed by the DOC first before forwarding it onto the victim. 
*No expungement
*AODA  Assessment & comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Forrest Matthew Thill
Current: 2312 Co. Rd. HH, Cuba City, WI 53807   (Effective: 07-27-2016)
Prior: 3500 Bush St Apt 23, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States

Defendant Forest Thill in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:37 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.

There is an agreement.

State has filed an amended information - amending Count 1 into two Counts.

Court should also have a proposed ordered.

Defendant will enter into pleas of Count 1 and Count 2. Subject to the proposed order, there would be a deferred prosecution agreement in Count 1. 
Count 2 would have withheld sentence, 12 mo probation, $50 fine/costs/surcharges, aoda and comply, ALCO, DRUGS, all prescriptions from single pharmacy, counseling as recommended, no contact with victim C.Z., write letter of apology. Upon successful completion of probation and bond  conditions and no new criminal charges, Count 1 would be dismissed without a JOC being entered.

Atty Smith concurs.
Atty Smith received a copy of the amended information, waives reading.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST  to both Count 1 and Count 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Smith for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim is not present. There was proper notice provided.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  
Clerk directed to WITHOLD ENTRY of Judgment of Conviction this date, Count 1.
Count 1: AMENDED: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date, Count 2.
Count 2: AMENDED: Contrary to the statute section stated therein

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Court signs the prepared order as to Count 1 based on plea negotiations in this case
Matter will be dismissed upon successful completion of probation

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Smith makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation. Atty Smith requests expungement.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $50 plus costs
No DNA Surcharge
AODA Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations if there are any
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Fill all prescriptions from a single pharmacy
Sign necessary releases so dept can monitor compliance
Comply with counseling as recommended by the agent
No contact with C.Z. with the exception of a letter of apology but only upon the DOC confirming that the victim wants any contact whatsoever. If she does, then the letter of apology must be reviewed by DOC first before forwarding it on to the victim

No expungement
20 days in which to appeal the case

Copies of order will go to counsel.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 26, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Forest Thill in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:33 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
This is a preliminary hearing. 
Address is verified.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued

State files Information.  Count 1 is only count in the Information.
Defendant / attorney received copy of information.
Defendant / attorney waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.
3:36 p.m. case is concluded.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

$5,000 sig bond:  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  on court dates. No contact with C.M.Z.

Defendant Forest Thill in court with attorney Smith. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be amended on the record. First name is Forrest is corrected.   Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
State request a sig bond.
BTC: $5,000 sig bond:  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  on court dates. No contact with C.M.Z.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
